confession.devil_appearance: Man in black with a circle around his hat
confession.seduction_date: Two years before trial (approximately 1580), on last day of la Magdellaine
confession.seduction_context: Gathering wood by fontaine de Saulcy, muttering curses about the German doctor who had called her a witch. Devil appeared and offered her powder to harm and heal people.
powder_types: powder to kill or make ill
powder in warm ashes to cure
sabbat_locations: Around large oak (first meeting, 8 days after seduction)
sabbat_activities: Danced rondeau around large oak to tune of 'Amour, amour my moine'

witnesses.name: Catherine Humbert veuve Jean Humbert
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Former housemate (lived in same house for 4 years)

testimony.threat_quote: Je scay bien qu'il a heu beaucoup de mal et qu'il n'a guieres repose
tante Nicole vous avez les mains bien douce

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Mongeatte des Woirel (suspected more than Nicole)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Goose incident and speaking ill of Nicole to sergent
testimony.threat_quote: meschante femme, je ne te vis jamais et ne t'a cognu
Que l'on l'avoit appellée Genaixe, pourquoy aymoit mieulx estre noyée que bruslée, et qu'elle n'estoit genaixe

testimony.quarrel_subject: Doctor called her witch; payment disputes
testimony.threat_quote: que l'on avoit beau a faire de luy donner des medicines, qu'il ne seroit guery s'elle n'y mectoit la main

witnesses.name: Claudon Voyrien
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Neighbor/employer (daughter attended veillée at their house)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Insufficient payment for healing daughter; lack of hospitality (wine)
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il s'en retourne, car le coeur de sa fille monteroit en haute et mourroit la nuict, comme ung poullet

witnesses.name: Nicole femme Jean Jour le Jeusne

testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle avisa la guerir, car elle luy avoit donné le mal, autrement elle s'en resentiroit

witnesses.name: Michiel Bonniller
witnesses.occupation: sergent du mayeur de St Nicolas

testimony.threat_quote: ny vouloir venir, pour ce que sy elle y alloit, il Bonniller peult estre feroit comme Pierrat Gorgelat aussy sergent feit de la gastade et qu'il pourroit dire, qu'elle estoit genaixe, et la faire brusler
que c'estoit elle qui entretenoit son mal

timeline.subject: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
timeline.details: Publicly accused of witchcraft by Mongeatte femme Jean Recouvreur, who was going about streets and gardens 'comme forcenée'. Nicole threw herself down a well.

timeline.subject: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
timeline.details: Interrogation - admitted throwing self in well due to despair after being called witch

timeline.subject: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
timeline.details: Interrogation - judges pressed her hard, alleging healing was cover for witchcraft

timeline.subject: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
timeline.details: Procureur général de Lorraine (Maimbourg) asks for question extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - confessed when severely racked, immediately retracted, varied between confessing and denying

timeline.subject: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
timeline.details: Interrogation - sergent reported she was ready to confess. Gave detailed confession of devil pact and maleficia

timeline.subject: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
timeline.details: Additional depositions from new witnesses to maléfices she confessed

timeline.subject: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
timeline.details: PG asks for death sentence, preceded by further torture to extract complete confession with names of accomplices

timeline.subject: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence if she confirms earlier confessions; no mention of further torture

accomplices_named.name: 4 unknown women
accomplices_named.location: Thought to be from Lenoncourt and La Neufville
accomplices_named.context: Met at sabbat 8 days after seduction by devil, danced around large oak

prior_accusations.accuser_name: la Bourguinatte (aunt of Marie femme Colin Bourlier)
prior_accusations.context: Aunt had been executed as a witch - mentioned as part of Nicole's reputation

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
notable_quotes.context: When asked why she was in prison

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
notable_quotes.french: maladieuse qu'elle est, et desja surexigé, ne desire que rendre a Dieu l'ame qu'il luy at preste
notable_quotes.english: being sick as she is, and already aged, desires only to return to God the soul he has lent her
notable_quotes.context: Responding to suggestion she intended suicide

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
notable_quotes.french: Interrogée pour quelle maladie - A dict que pour le mal de la mere, elle recueille ladite graine quant elle est meure, entre les deux notre dame, puis la mect sur ung peu de brasier, et de la fumée en forme d'estuve se guarissent les patientes
notable_quotes.english: Asked what illness - Said for mal de la mere, she collects the seed when it is ripe, between the two Notre Dames, then puts it on a small brazier, and from the smoke in form of steam the patients are cured
notable_quotes.context: Describing her herbal healing technique using herb St Gegoult

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Voyrien
notable_quotes.french: qu'il s'en retourne, car le coeur de sa fille monteroit en haute et mourroit la nuict, comme ung poullet
notable_quotes.english: that he should go home, for his daughter's heart would rise up high and she would die in the night, like a chicken
notable_quotes.context: Nicole's prophecy about death of Alizon, daughter of Claudon Voyrien

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehannon femme Nicolas Gergonne
notable_quotes.french: Que l'on l'avoit appellée Genaixe, pourquoy aymoit mieulx estre noyée que bruslée, et qu'elle n'estoit genaixe
notable_quotes.english: That she had been called a witch, therefore she preferred to be drowned than burned, and that she was not a witch
notable_quotes.context: Nicole's statement after being rescued from well

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal (confession)
notable_quotes.french: Le larron, le poltron, le grand Diable le puisse confondre, il m'appelle genaixe, et ne le suis poinct, continuant ainsy ses maudisssons et propos de Diable
notable_quotes.english: The thief, the coward, may the great Devil confound him, he calls me a witch, and I am not one, continuing thus her curses and devil's speech
notable_quotes.context: Muttering at fontaine de Saulcy when devil appeared to seduce her

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
notable_quotes.french: estant qu'elle est pauvre seulette et destituée d'avis pour se justifier
notable_quotes.english: being that she is poor, alone, and destitute of counsel to justify herself
notable_quotes.context: Responding to judges' pressure during interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal
notable_quotes.french: sy l'on veut adjouster foidz aux faulx tesmoings qui deposent contre elle de choses que ne furent jamais elle ayme tout aultant moyrir
notable_quotes.english: if they want to give faith to false witnesses who testify against her of things that never happened, she would just as soon die

relationships.evidence_text: First marriage had been to chartier named Jean Lescabelle, and had lasted 14 years
Nicole veuve Mengin Nigal - widow of a gisseur
father named Jean de Mallein, but had never known father or mother
Had two children, who had been absent long since; one was in Allemaigne
did not know where other was
Subsequently Nicole had been to see her neighbour, wife of Didier Regnaudin
Her aunt 'la Bourguinatte' had been executed as a witch

relationships.person1: Nicole femme Jean Jour le Jeusne
relationships.evidence_text: Nicole femme Jean Jour le Jeusne

relationships.person2: Dame Meline femme au Sr Hanry Go de Neufchastel
relationships.evidence_text: Had learned technique from Dame Meline femme au Sr Hanry Go de Neufchastel, elle detenue estant jeusne garse pour berser leurs enffans
Said they had lived in same house (in different rooms) for four years
Had lived in same house for last year
tante Nicole vous avez les mains bien douce - addressed her as 'tante'

economic_context.details: Nicole was economically vulnerable - a poor widow who practiced healing for income. Her husband had left for war during a period of dearth, leaving her alone and destitute. She relied on healing fees but often faced payment disputes. Evidence of poverty: lived in rented rooms, was evicted from lodging, charged modest fees (a franc, 6 deniers, 7 gros), sometimes asked for payment in kind (journal of wheat, bread and wine). Her economic desperation is central to her story - the interrogation explicitly asked if being 'pauvre et necessiteuse' when her husband left had led her to turn to witchcraft.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Very painful leg, looked normal but felt hot to touch, strange lump in thigh
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Being put out of house where she was living because treating him
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Treatment - decoction d'herbes, graisse de chartier; possibly powder in confession

harms_catalog.attributed_to: Uncertain - witness thought Mongeatte des Woirelz

harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: Same evening after Nicole put hand on her skin
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Touch - Nicole put hand on her skin

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fell on flat road with child face down beneath her, became chilled, arm and thigh twisted, could hardly walk
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Goose incident (Nicole's goose jumped on drying sheets), spoken ill to sergent
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 15 days after goose incident, fall on day of fete at Rozieres
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Threw cone of paper (that had contained powder) on road (per confession)

harms_catalog.harm_description: Very ill, spent much money at Nancy seeking cure in vain
harms_catalog.economic_value: Much money spent at Nancy and elsewhere
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Called Nicole witch while ill herself (per confession)
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Powder (per confession) - made ill when Nicole was ill herself and witness called her witch

harms_catalog.victim_name: Child aged 3 of Pierre Perrin Warier

harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness, pain went down into feet, still afflicted
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: They had forgotten her after cure, doctor called her witch, wife asked for journal of wheat
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: Illness returned for 6 weeks after he had been cured
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Powder (per confession) - made ill and cured, made ill again when discontented

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fell very ill after Nicole threatened her with finger, died same night
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Failed to recompense properly (gave 6 deniers), failed to offer wine, came too late to call her for supper

harms_catalog.victim_name: Wife of Jean Jour le Jeusne
harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness, became worse after insufficient payment
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Insufficient payment (7 gros when Nicole wanted 30)
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Powder (per confession) - went out too soon after childbirth, called Nicole witch

harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness, vomited violently after herbal drink
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused Nicole of maintaining her illness
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Treatment - felt better only when Nicole did the massage herself

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute over firewood she bought from him

harms_catalog.harm_description: Made to believe it was mal de mere (per confession)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Did not let Nicole go first at well on very cold day

harms_catalog.harm_description: Child died after languishing 4-5 weeks, seemed asleep for 3 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute with wife, not invited to baptism

harms_catalog.harm_description: Mal de mere, treated and better for 3 years then relapsed
Child very ill, told it was tenu de mauvais gens

historical_context.military_details: Nicole's husband left for war during the dearth (period of food scarcity). This military mobilization coincided with economic hardship and left Nicole destitute.
economic_hardship_indicators: Dearth (food scarcity) mentioned when husband left for war
Nicole described as 'pauvre et necessiteuse' (poor and destitute)
Nicole worked as domestic servant in 5 households before marriages
Lived in rented rooms, was evicted from lodging
Relied on healing fees for survival
Asked for payment in kind (wheat, bread, wine)
religious_calendar_references: la Magdellaine (feast of Mary Magdalene, July 22)
entre les deux notre dame (between the two Notre Dames - likely Assumption Aug 15 and Nativity Sept 8)
Lent mentioned in threat: 'qu'il fut sept ans de Caresmes ils s'en repentiroient'

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Held prisoner on orders of Procureur général after suicide attempt in well

change_de_nancy.modification_details: PG requested death preceded by further torture to extract accomplice names on Aug 31. Change de Nancy approved death on Sept 4 if she confirmed earlier confessions, but made no mention of further torture - appears to have rejected that aspect of PG's request.

hearsay_chains.content: How Nicole had used same remedy

emotional_state_notes: Despairing - said she wished she were dead
Resigned - said she would rather die than be believed false witnesses

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Denied healing Mongeatte, but admitted attending her
Blamed stepmother for feeding child 'choux a l'huile', disputed timing of pilgrimages
Said doctor had been using worthless 'estuves', what was needed was pilgrimage

third_parties.name: Dame Meline femme au Sr Hanry Go de Neufchastel
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: Former employer who taught her healing technique
third_parties.context: Taught Nicole the herbal healing technique for mal de mere, found it in a book

third_parties.name: German doctor
third_parties.context: Was distributing waters for illnesses, quarreled with Nicole, called her witch, told Villermin he had 'mal donné'. His accusation triggered Nicole's seduction by devil (per confession).

third_parties.name: Mongeatte des Woirelz (Woirel)
third_parties.context: Catherine femme Jean Cordier suspected Mongeatte more than Nicole for her husband's illness. Mongeatte healed Cordier's child immediately with herbs.

third_parties.name: maitre Persin
third_parties.context: Name given to devil who seduced Nicole and gave her powder

extraction_metadata.notes: This is an exceptionally detailed trial record with complete witness depositions, confession narrative, and procedural timeline. Key uncertainties: (1) Several witness depositions noted but not included in full (witnesses 10-11 were too ill to testify; witnesses 13-14 knew nothing). (2) Initial interrogation has no date specified. (3) The confession mentions 4 unknown women at sabbat but Nicole could not identify them - only thought they were from Lenoncourt and La Neufville. (4) Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on extensive evidence: widow of gisseur, former servant, lived in rented rooms, evicted from lodging, payment disputes, husband left her destitute during dearth, described as 'pauvre et necessiteuse'. (5) The Change de Nancy's ruling on Sept 4 approved death but did NOT mention further torture, which the PG had requested on Aug 31 - this appears to be a modification rejecting that aspect. (6) This trial is particularly significant for understanding the intersection of folk healing, economic vulnerability, and witchcraft accusations. Nicole's healing practice using herbal fumigation for 'mal de mere' was learned from an elite household and practiced for 10 years. The trial shows how payment disputes and professional rivalry (with German doctor and possibly Mongeatte des Woirel) contributed to accusations.
